data.title: Good place to eat
data.text: This is a good place for a business meeting with good food, good service, and good atmosphere. We were there for lunch, which is buffet style.

user_location.name: Rapid City, South Dakota, United States

data.title: something new something delicious
data.text: a friend chose this restaurant for lunch and it was delicious.  the smell from the minute you walk in is incredible. They have a lunch buffet which has a good selection of different dishes.  I love curry so this was perfect. service is very good also

data.title: The food was good
data.text:
We went there for a weekday dinner.  It wasn’t busy but our server wasn’t attentive or helpful.  We didn’t know what to order so I picked Chicken Curry and Chicken Tikka Masala for my mother and me.  I did because I know what curry looks/tastes like and I like Trader Joe’s Chicken Tikka Masala; I asked the server to make them mild. To be honest, I don’t know the difference between curry and tikka masala; they taste very similar to me.  We tried both, side by side, with rice; my mother liked curry a little better and I liked tikka masala little better.  To me, tikka masala tasted a little creamier than curry.  I would’ve enjoyed even more if we had a side of chutneys but it didn’t come with the dishes and I didn’t want to ask for them.  
A heated political debate (or a passionate lecture) was going on at the next table over a bottle of red wine which was entertaining and annoying at the same time.  
The food was good but I suggest you go with somebody that is knowledgeable in Indian/Nepalese/Tibetan cuisine.

data.title: Surprisingly good Indian
data.text: Made it here for the lunch buffet and everything was tasty and well prepared. Friendly service and very good naan bread that is made fresh when ordered. Others mentioned that it was spicy but I thought it was all fine and not overly spicy. Would recommend if you want some tasty Indian food.

data.title: Very good, handy location
data.text: A group of 12 of us, including someone in a wheelchair, had lunch here. We had the buffet and it had many foods on it that (I have to admit) I didn't recognize. I tried a little of most choices and they were good. My favorite was the Mango Pudding. Give it a try!

data.title: Close to hotel
data.text: Portions are huge, service was good, but food average and spicy. Left more food than I ate. Would pick a different place next time.

data.title: "Delicious"
data.text: Simply needed my curry "Fix" taken care of and this place did it!! The lamb was succulent tender goodness! Finished the night with some Taj Mahal beer and called it good. A great experience and highly recommend it.

data.title: Melt in your mouth
data.text: So delicious, we couldn't stop eating our plentiful portions. We asked for medium spicy, and that is what we got to perfection. The tandoori chicken tikka was melt in your mouth good, and the aloo gobi had a distinctive taste (wonderfully) and a little more heat. If I lived in town, I'd be returning soon.

data.title: very good
data.text: Very good quality of food. The food is pretty authentic and well prepared. I love they have a buffet on weekends and this gives you the opportunity to taste small portions of different dishes

data.title: Best Indiana food!
data.text: We never had Indian food before. This was our first time and we absolutely loved it! Great food! Would definitely recommend going here!

data.title: Best Indian food !!!!!!!!
data.text: A must eat when I come to rapid ! The food is amazing ! Sometimes the service is slow but just have some patience because the food is worth the wait !!!!!!!!

data.title: Food was not good. Service was good
data.text:
I went to this restaurant after seeing the glowing reviews. And bought enough food for two meals. I was totally disappointed. The two curries that we ordered were not tasty at all. Bread was ok. 
I planned to eat a lot of of Indian food in this trip. After having this food, I am not eating Indian food outside for another month. 
May be the buffet is good here and may be that's where the good reviews are coming from. Or maybe the non vegetarian options are good. Not sure. Don't want to try either. 

The service was good. That's about it.

data.title: Location Vs Taste
data.text: Location is great, service on the slow side, Taste on the poor side. Food was good quality but they have changed the taste to what the dish should be. need to be more Authentic.

data.title: Tasty Food
data.text:
We were very surprised, but glad, to find so many ethnic Restaurants in Rapid City. This one was across the street from our Hotel, so we ventured here for Dinner after our usual tiring day of sightseeing.

We started off with Mixed Pakoras for Appetizers along with some glasses of Red Wine. We followed this with Shrimp Curry and Chicken Biryani for the Main Courses. It was good to find out that the chef caters to the customer’s taste buds. We requested the food to be “Medium Spicy”, and this was perfect. The Curry and the Rice had just the right amount of kick to enhance the spices, without overwhelming the tongue to a point where one cannot even taste the flavors. The Onion Kulcha was fresh, hot and very tasty.

The prices were very reasonable, and the servers are all very polite.  The portions were quite large. Had we known this prior to ordering, we would have only got one dish between the two of us. We felt really bad about wasting half of our food, since we were leaving the following morning, and could not carry the leftovers back to our Hotel.

A nice place that we would like to return to if we come back to South Dakota.

data.title: Delightful treat
data.text: Had a great meal there.  Friendly service.  Didn't expect to find great Indian/Nepalese food in Rapid City.  Go there.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: Hard to believe that I had the best malai kofta of my life in Rapid City, South Dakota, but there you have it. Here's how good the food is here: they mixed up our order, but by the time we figured out it wasn't the dish we ordered, we already ate most of it. The host didn't charge us for it, of course, but we paid anyway. Seriously, go eat there.

data.title: I don't know what the hype is about....
data.text: My wife and I arrived hoping to have some good food as we hear people rave about this place. We were promptly seated at a dirty table with dirty menus on the plates on which we are expected to eat... We ordered the garlic naan bread because again people rave about it, it was just okay the garlic tasted slightly raw and burnt at the same time... We then ordered main dishes the Bhendi Masala and the Lamb Rack Tandoori... It only took 30 minutes for the Bhendi Masala to come out and it was ok, it had zero salt but i guess the iodized salt at the table makes up for that. The lamb came out about 15 minutes later just hammered, it looked like someone had hacked that lamb up and it was beyond well done just not good and all it came with was some slightly cooked onions, cilantro, two minuscule pieces of green pepper and the smallest lemon wedge one could cut... There appeared to be only one waiter for the whole dining room and we had the pleasure to interact with him once. So all in all I wonder what restaurant all the other reviewers ate at... After being there for an hour and a half and waiting patiently to get someone to come check back with us, we decided to take matters into our own hands and flag down someone (who looked like a deer in headlights) to get us a bill and some to-go boxes for the overpriced over cooked food that I just could not justify throwing away...

data.title: Excellent Indian Food
data.text: We sat outside at this restaurant and got to watch the colorful sidewalk goers. I ordered an ice tea, which was a total surprise when it arrived. This was the most flavorful, spiced ice tea that I have ever had. We ordered the chicken kadai and the chicken saag. To that we added the keema naan. Everything was wonderfully tasty and the service very polite and attentive. These meals had some of the most interesting fusion of spices I have ever had the pleasure of tasting.

data.title: One of my favorites
data.text: I live in Rapid City and this is one of my favorite eating spots.  I love the food and the service. Buffet style.

data.title: Great Nepali in Rapid City? Get the heck out of here!
data.text: If you are sensitive to spicy food; you are done for. If you like great Indian and or Nepali cuisine, this is as good as it gets.
